1.text: The point of what we are saying is this: we have such a high priest, who sat down at the right hand of the throne of the Majesty on high,

2.text: a servant of the sanctuary and of the true tabernacle, which the Lord has set up, and not man.

3.text: Every high priest is appointed to offer both gifts and sacrifices. Therefore, it is necessary that this high priest should also have something to offer.

4.text: For if Jesus were on earth, he would not be a priest at all, because there are priests who [still] offer gifts according to the law.

5.text: They offer divine service to a copy and a shadow of the heavenly things, even as Moses was warned by God when he was about to build the tabernacle. For God said:  Behold, you shall make everything according to the pattern that was shown to you on the mountain.

6.text: But now, Jesus has obtained a more excellent ministry as he is also the mediator of a better covenant, given as law on better promises.

7.text: If that first covenant had been without fault, there would have been no place to look for a second one.

8.text: But finding fault with them, God said:  Behold, the days are coming, says the Lord,   that I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel,   and with the house of Judah;

9.text: not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers,   in the day when I took them by the hand   to lead them out of the land of Egypt;   for they did not continue in my covenant,   and I ignored them, says the Lord.

10.text: This is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel:   After those days, says the Lord;   I will put my laws into their mind,   I will also write them on their hearts.   I will be their God,   and they will be my people.

11.text: They will not [have to ] teach everyone his fellow citizen,   and everyone his relative, saying: ‘Know the Lord,’   for all will know me,   from their least to their greatest.

12.text: For I will be merciful to their unrighteousness;   I will remember their sins and lawless deeds no more.

13.text: By speaking of a new covenant, God has made the first one old. And what is becoming obsolete and aging will soon disappear.
